title: Continuous Control in Active Inference
description: Understanding how Active Inference handles continuous state spaces and continuous control problems.
learning_objectives: Apply Active Inference to dynamical systems

content.overview: Continuous control extends Active Inference to systems with continuous state spaces and continuous actions. This involves modeling continuous dynamics, designing continuous policies, and optimizing expected free energy over continuous trajectories.

continuous_state_spaces.mean_and_covariance: Track mean and uncertainty of state estimates

continuous_dynamics.transition_densities: p(s_{t+1} | s_t, a_t) from continuous dynamics

continuous_policies.trajectory_optimization: Optimize entire paths, not just single actions

expected_free_energy_for_continuous_syst.path_integrals: Expected free energy over continuous trajectories
expected_free_energy_for_continuous_syst.gradient_flow: Policy updates as gradient descent on expected free energy

examples.name: Linear Quadratic Regulator
examples.cost: Quadratic cost on states and controls
examples.solution: Linear feedback policy minimizing expected free energy

numerical_methods.discretization: Convert continuous problems to discrete approximations

connections_to_control_theory.optimal_control: Active Inference as generalized optimal control

interactive_exercises.description: Plan optimal trajectories in continuous space

common_misconceptions.misconception: Active Inference only works for discrete systems

common_misconceptions.clarification: Can be more efficient with appropriate approximations
